bwwExcerpt: "The duo gave a tight, nuanced performance, complete with convincing Chicago accents. Jackman, who won a Tony Award for his 2004 Broadway debut in The Boy From Oz, was enthralling as the big hearted but corrupt cop.By turns humorous, dark and tense, the actors handled Keith Huff's evenly paced drama, directed by John Crowley, with a skill and subtlety which rarely gets chance to shine in Hollywood."
